intro: Dyschoriste hildebrandtii var. mollis, commonly known as the soft-haired dyschoriste, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy, soft leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowering period usually occurs during the warmer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The species is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
